data.title: Is this a bug?
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot version 2.1.2 Linux XUbuntu 16.04.1

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Hi, I'm getting an suspicious behavior in a sub scene. Description:
When add an new scene named Barrier (an StaticBody2D with a sub child collision shape being a RectangleShape2D) it doesn't collide properly like it should. For example, if the player enter the Barrier shape in the right or the left or down side, the collision doesn't work. But, if the player enter by the top side of shape, so it collide with shape and the behavior is a collision. This kind of behavior of my Barrier with player it's like an One-way-platform, but I want that Barrier with full side collision.

I've try load my Barrier.tscn in other new project test, and... it works! Only in my main project do not. 
For this, I suspected be a bug.

**Steps to reproduce:**
I don't know the exactly steps, but it occurs in my project only.

**Link to minimal example project:**
If you want my project to give a try, download here:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/cz283ewraqcbwok/MeuPlatformer.tar.gz?dl=0
#

data.title: xCode added xcuserdata to gitignore
data.body:
this file gets autogenerted for the xcodeproject in:
```misc/dist/ios_xcode/godot_xcode/godot_ios.xcodeproj/xcuserdata```
it contains information about the current state of excode: which folders are expanded in the ProjectManager, which file is open...

data.title: X11 return to cwd at exit
data.body:
During runtime godot calls chdir() several times. This doesn't really
matter normally but when using tools such as gprof the location of the
profiling data is kind of hard to intuit.

With this PR we simply store the current working directory at start and
restore it once we're almost done exiting.

This doesn't use the OS abstractions as when we need to get the current
workdir we haven't yet initialized it (by necessity). This would break
if we tried to build X11 for windows, but since the X11 target is
hardcoded to use the UNIX abstractions I don't think it matters.

data.title: X11: Move audio driver finalize to the start of cleanup
data.body:
The audio driver cleanup needs to happen at the start of finish
otherwise a race still seems to exist with the destruction of the
audioserver. I think that destroying the X resoures before has something
to do with it.

@akien-mga Sorry for the double PR, I previously tested it in this location, then noticed that win32 does it later and I apparently never retested...

data.title: Question on multi Threading efficiency
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Processor quad core
Windows 7 and 10
Godot 2.1.2 stable
Godot legacy branch compiled 19/01/2017

**Issue description:**
I try to make a thread pool singleton. It creates a fixed count of Threads, I feed it with tasks and it tries to keep the threads busy as much as possible until every task is done. But I've met negative improvement of the computation time of my tasks.

I've then made an experiment:
use a simple function that takes lot of time, a for loop incrementing a variable.

I run it once, it takes 200ms to execute.
I run it in a thread, it takes 200ms.
I run it 4 times, it takes 800ms to finish. Normal.
I run it in 4 threads, it takes 550 ms. 0.66 times the previous result. Kinda disappointing.

I check in the profiler:
On the average, the function needs 200ms when executed single threaded.
On the average, the function needs 400ms when executed in many separate threads. The more threads, the slower will be the function.

I use a compiled version of godot that corresponds to the legacy branch of 19/01/2017, I also tried on the version 2.1.2 stable and the results were worse.

I open this issue to ask if this behaviour seems normal. I've already messed with multithreading in C and Java on quad-cores and cutting 2/3 of the computation time is not an usual result for me.


**Steps to reproduce:**
```gdscript
func _ready():
	var test_count = 4
	var arg1 = 500000
	var start
	var stop
	var test_time
	var test_multi_time

	start = OS.get_ticks_msec()
	for i in range(test_count):
		test(arg1)
	stop = OS.get_ticks_msec()
	test_time = stop-start
	
	var threads = []
	threads.append( Thread.new() )
	threads.append( Thread.new() )
	threads.append( Thread.new() )
	threads.append( Thread.new() )
	start = OS.get_ticks_msec()
	for i in range(test_count):
		threads[i].start(self, "test_multi", arg1)
	threads[0].wait_to_finish()
	threads[1].wait_to_finish()
	threads[2].wait_to_finish()
	threads[3].wait_to_finish()
	stop = OS.get_ticks_msec()
	test_multi_time = stop-start

	
	print("test : ", test_time)
	print("test multi: ", test_multi_time)
	print("ratio: ", float(test_multi_time)/test_time)
	

func test(arg1):
	var acc = 0
	for i in range(arg1):
		acc +=1
	return acc

func test_multi(arg1):
	var acc = 0
	for i in range(arg1):
		acc +=1
	return acc
```

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->:

data.title: Ready function of child called after entire adding function is done, if parent node is not ready.
data.body:
Change in _ready behavior from 2.1.1 to 2.1.2


**Issue description:**
Strange behavior when adding a node to a node that is not ready yet.
Adding a child to a node, which is not yet ready, triggers the ready function of the child only after the  function, which is adding the child, is done.
The issue here would be an unexpected break in sequence, since normally the ready function is called right after the add_child( new_child_instance ) is done. 

**Link to minimal example project:**

In this small example it is shown that adding a child node to a not yet ready node gives a different sequence (add_child(), print(), child._ready() ) to when the same is done to a node which is ready (add_child(), child._ready(), print() ).

[ready.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/783503/ready.zip)

data.title: X11: Finalize audiodrivers on exit
data.body:
The audiodrivers loaded by OS_X11 are not destroyed before the
audioserver is. This causes a segfault on exit.

The code is taken from os_windows.cpp which did have the cleanup code.

data.title: Secondary alignment for BoxContainer.
data.body:
This allows to set the vertical alignment for HBoxContainers and the horizontal alignment for VBoxContainers.
I'd liked to rename the properties to clearer names (like VerticalAlign/HorizontalAlign), but didn't know how to do it without breaking compatibility.

data.title: Point Sprites: POINT_SIZE / POINT_COORD not working in shader
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
- Windows 7 64 Bit - NVIDIA GTX 760 (Desktop) - Godot_v2.1.2-stable_win64.exe
- Windows 7 64 Bit - NVIDIA Quadro K1100M (Laptop) - Godot_v2.1.1-stable_win64.exe

**Issue description:**
I use an ImmediateGeometry to render some random point cloud. I set a shader material

Expected: setting POINT_SIZE in Vertex Shader should increase point size
What I get: POINT_SIZE has no effect on my Desktop but on my Laptop.

Expected: using POINT_COORD in Fragment Shaders should give me either multicolored squares if I use:

`DIFFUSE = vec3(POINT_COORD.x, POINT_COORD.y, 1);`

like in this example I found: 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25827515/23036336/b6326e80-f482-11e6-9ec6-76eb06e84869.png)

or a textured point sprite if I use:

```
uniform texture star;
DIFFUSE = tex(star, POINT_COORD).rgb;
```
like in this example:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25827515/23036353/c95d108c-f482-11e6-808f-f0e25cdcd0c5.png)

What I get: black squares on my Laptop or black dots on my Desktop:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25827515/23036426/1618f468-f483-11e6-8a4f-5793487cb806.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
Start the attached projekt. You should either get black squares or black dots around white plane.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[PointSpritesTest1.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/781200/PointSpritesTest1.gz)






.

data.title: Improved AStar
data.body:
Hi,

I've improved the usability of the AStar class to be able to handle delegate to calculate distances between nodes.
I found the stock implementation too limited to straight lines where my project is using a custom method to compute distance between nodes, I am actually using splines instead of straight lines, so my changes allow for this by adding a delegate which then calls "compute_cost" on the delegate, or "estimate_cost" for cost estimation.

I've also added support for exhaustive AStar searching, flags and bindings for nodes.

If you just diff the files against the stock astar you will see my changes. I would like to see them merged in if you deem the changes suitable.


[astar2.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/779889/astar2.zip)

data.title: Support 1024 width resolution in scrip view, possibly others (1024x768)
data.body:
Windows 7, Godot 2.1

I use Godot during game design workshops. Only a 1024x768 projector is available unfortunately.

It would be beneficial to situations in which low definition display hardware is available only to be able to still use Godot properly.

Most views seem to work fine at this resolution but opening a .gd file seems to lock the text view to a certain width, that blocks out the right side bar.

Please allow resizing the text widget, to support 1024 width.

I dont know how to reproduce, but it appears that other views at times get locked into a minimal width in the center area, blocking out the right side bar. Please check if you can, wherther there are views/situations, in which the main viewport would not allow resizing to a size that would allow showing the right sidebar on a 1024 screen.

Thanks!
![1024width screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/18312/23018510/74425f42-f43e-11e6-870e-e3a30995e633.PNG)

data.title: Ability to export Node types
data.body:
Could we have a shortcut to assign Nodes in the inspector instead of only relying on NodePath?

Explanation:
I had to link individual nodes several times in my project, especially in tool scripts,
but I quickly found that I was repeating myself doing so.

Everytime, my code looked like this:


```gdscript
export(NodePath) var node = null setget set_node_path

var _node = null


func set_node_path(path):
	node = path
	if is_inside_tree():
		_update_node_field()


func _update_node_field():
	if node != null:
		var n = get_node(node)
		if n extends Node2D:
			_node = n
		else:
			print("Error: the node must be Node2D!")
			node = null
	else:
		_node = null


func _ready():
	_update_node_field()
```

I have to:
- Use a backing field to store the actual node
- test if we are in the tree to get it because otherwise access is denied.
- update it in _ready() because deserialisation happens before it.
- check for nulls because you can leave the path empty.
- check the type because I usually need a specific one.
- Eventually test if the path is valid before getting the node (not in the example)
- Eventually do some more tests when setting the property (not in the example)

That's a lot of boilerplate, just for ONE property.

It would be really cool if we could instead have this:

```gdscript
export(Node2D) node setget set_node

# Property example, executed on ready
func set_node(node):
	# Do custom logic
	# ...
```

This would still be saved as a NodePath, however at deserialization, if the exported type inherits Node, 
all of the previous boilerplate would be done to assign the field automatically.
As a bonus, because the node type is known, we can prevent designers from assigning wrong node types in the editor by greying them out in the selection window and cancelling drag and drop.

It won't break compatibility either because using NodePath would still work if needed.

What do you think?

data.title: Feature request: Like the new $, but for find_node
data.body:
Just reading the devblog and I love the new $ shorthand for get_node in v3! I tend to use find_node more because it's not affected if I revise the node tree later; could we also get an alias for that? 

If `$Button` is `get_node('Button')`, maybe `$$Button` = `find_node('Button')`? Doesn't have to be $$ - that was just my first thought.

data.title: Item_list_ensure_current_is_visible scrolls the scrolling but the icons does not move
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10
Godot V 2.1

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Item_list_ensure_current_is_visible scrolls the scrolling but the icons does not move. This might be intentional? I wouldn't know  first bug report

**Steps to reproduce:**
my code looks like this for the itemlist : ("inventory" being the itemlist)
```gdscript
if inventory.is_selected(i) and inventory.get_item_metadata(i).size() == 10: #
    inventory.ensure_current_is_visible()
    highest_value_dice = inventory.get_item_metadata(i)[2]
    lowest_value_dice = inventory.get_item_metadata(i)[1]
    attack_range = inventory.get_item_metadata(i)[9]
    now_wielding = inventory.get_item_text(i)
```
This is under the "on_ItemLis_item_activated" func and everything works great.
Here is the issue:
![first screen](http://image.prntscr.com/image/0d494d7346a041a6a7546ea3881a5b5b.png) - once items have been picked up the scroll appears as it should
![second screen](http://image.prntscr.com/image/f2423ccb158145b29095ce0aaa14ca3f.png) - doubble tapping then "activates" the item and inventory.ensure_current_is_visible() runs. The scroll also moves but the items stand still.
![third screen](http://image.prntscr.com/image/134aea31b30f4ec19f16cdeca5e253ea.png) - clicking once more on the item will give the result I was looking for, where the full item name and icon are revealed and the scroll appears to work.

Hope this makes sense, It seems like a bug or something of the like, so I probably won't need this to work "better", but thought I'd show it anyway in case it is a bug :)

Have a nice day

**Link to minimal example project:**

*Bugsquad edit*: make images be images, not links

data.title: Correct hash behavior for floating point numbers
data.body:
Correct hash behavior for floating point numbers

This fixes HashMap where a key or part of a key is a floating point
number. To fix this the following has been done:

* HashMap now takes an extra template argument Comparator. This class
gets used to compare keys. The default Comperator now works correctly
for common types and floating point numbets.

* Variant implements ::hash_compare() now. This function implements
nan-safe comparison for all types with components that contain floating
point numbers.

* Variant now has a VariantComparator which uses Variant::hash_compare()
safely compare floating point components of variant's types.

* The hash functions for floating point numbers will now normalize NaN 
values so that all floating point numbers that are NaN hash to the same
value.

C++ module writers that want to use HashMap internally in their modules
can now also safeguard against this crash by defining their on
Comperator class that safely compares their types.

GDScript users, or writers of modules that don't use HashMap internally
in their modules don't need to do anything.

This fixes #7354 and fixes #6947.

data.title: SceneTreeTimer: Ability to set pause mode
data.body:
Adds an additional flag to SceneTree::create_timer() that tells it whether or not to process when the game is paused.
Defaults to false in order to not break existing functionality.
Fixes #7656

data.title: FileSystem thumbnails display 2D scene (impressive bug!)
data.body:
3.0 master

**Issue description:**
Thumbnails are not displayed and instead an upside-down view on the editor 2D scene.
![test](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9631152/22951647/3e9504e2-f30a-11e6-979b-2bbc7c3764f7.gif)

This bug exists since several weeks now on Windows 10 x64 (possibly more OSes) so I thought I share it :)

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open any project, see thumbnails getting trashed and your console filled with things like this:
```
ERROR: _gl_debug_print: GL ERROR: Source: OpenGL        Type: Error     ID: 3010        Severity: High  Message: glBlitFramebuffer failed because the framebuffer configurations require that the source and destination formats and sample counts match (GL_INVALID_OPERATION)
   At: drivers\gles3\rasterizer_gles3.cpp:94
REIMPORTING: res://test_dir/.dontseeme.png
mesege
ERROR: _gl_debug_print: GL ERROR: Source: OpenGL        Type: Error     ID: 3010        Severity: High  Message: glBlitFramebuffer failed because the framebuffer configurations require that the source and destination formats and sample counts match (GL_INVALID_OPERATION)
   At: drivers\gles3\rasterizer_gles3.cpp:94
REIMPORTING: res://test_dir/absolutely_hidden.png
mesege
ERROR: _gl_debug_print: GL ERROR: Source: OpenGL        Type: Error     ID: 3010        Severity: High  Message: glBlitFramebuffer failed because the framebuffer configurations require that the source and destination formats and sample counts match (GL_INVALID_OPERATION)
   At: drivers\gles3\rasterizer_gles3.cpp:94
REIMPORTING: res://test_dir/rms.png
mesege
ERROR: _gl_debug_print: GL ERROR: Source: OpenGL        Type: Error     ID: 3010        Severity: High  Message: glBlitFramebuffer failed because the framebuffer configurations require that the source and destination formats and sample counts match (GL_INVALID_OPERATION)
   At: drivers\gles3\rasterizer_gles3.cpp:94
```

Also, if I make the editor window smaller than the "internal minimum size" (or what that is, when it stops resizing the inner contents), everything gets worse:
![untitled 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9631152/22952201/5a16f5b6-f30c-11e6-8f09-119e95c9fec2.png)

data.title: Allow preload to accept a const string.
data.body:
Allow preload to accept a const string.

In preload() parsing this code will lookup the identifier in the local
constant database. If the identifier corresponds to a string constant
it is used as the path for preload().

Currently this does not work for global constants, only constants
declared in the same class as the preload is happening. We can implement
a full fix too. Maybe we can use this PR to discuss the possibilities.

This (partially) fixes #6798

data.title: Feature suggestion : Duplicate files in file context menu
data.body: The file context menu has options for renaming and deleting files, how about one for duplicating files as well. I know there are other ways to duplicate scripts / scenes etc, but I think it could come in handy.

data.title: Make nan==nan true for GDScript
data.body:
After discussing this with Reduz this seemed like the best way to
fix #7354. This will make composite values that contain NaN in the same
places as well as the same other values compare as the same.

Additionally non-composite values now also compare equal if they are
both NaN. This breaks IEEE specifications but this is probably what most
users expect. There is a GDScript function check for NaN if the user
needs this information.

This fixes #7354 and probably also fixes #6947
